DOC.brief_summary: Asynchrony during mechanical ventilation has been poorly described in patients suffering from acute respiratory distress syndrome. The purpose of this study is to describe the frequency of asynchronies (ineffective efforts and double triggering) in these group and evaluate potential risk factors and prognosis implications.
DOC.brief_title: Asynchrony During Mechanical Ventilation in Patients With Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome
DOC.criteria: Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome according to Berlin definition Intubation and mechanical ventilation within 72 hours of inclusion Known severe neuromuscular disease Continuous neuromuscular blocking agents infusion
